description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

G Suite is a set of intelligent apps (i.e., Gmail, Docs, Drive, Calendar, Hangouts, and more) designed to bring people together, with real-time collaboration built in from the start. In this role, you will be motivated to impact the way enterprises around the world do work.

As the Program Manager for the Enterprise Programs team, you will identify, build, and run Programs that have direct impacts to G Suite business, customers, and products. You'll be able to improve the engagement with customers, increase G Suite product roadmap awareness and relevance, improve operational efficiency, and drive business growth.

The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience working cross-functionally.
  • Experience defining and setting up structures to enhance programs (i.e., Alpha, Beta, and General Availability).
  • Experience working with Product teams to drive decisions and partner with Sales teams to determine customer strategy.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in the enterprise software industry.
  • Experience developing detailed analyses, presentations, and support material to successfully implement a project, strategy, and/or change initiative.
  • Experience leading complex cross-functional initiatives.
  • Ability to develop effective relationships to facilitate collaboration, information gathering, and strategic decision making.
  • Ability to take initiative and identify and action on opportunities for process improvements.
  • Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously under timelines.
responsibilities:
• Partner with Product and Engineering to create sustainable processes for collecting, updating, and communicating the roadmap across multiple audiences (e.g., executives, Program Management, Engineering, Sales, Customer).
  • Define and lead enterprise guidelines, execution, and best practices for launches (e.g, trusted tester, early adopter program and general availability).
  • Connect the dots across products and product areas (PAs) and influence vision and strategy.
  • Partner with business to collect and analyze data including but not limited to customer issues, agreement/deployment challenges, requested features, and feed findings back into strategy and to Product teams.
  • Partner with Customer Engagement and Success teams to gather product use, stability, and performance data.
title: Program Manager, G Suite, Enterprise
